controllers

Class Application

  • java.lang.Object
    • Controller
      • controllers.Application

  • public class Application
extends Controller
    A control class that performs domain-free generic operations such as login and deny access.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Application()

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods

    • Constructor Detail

      • Application

        public Application()

    • Method Detail

      • index

        public static Result index()
        Render index page based on username and domain of current session. Assumption: the stored session is assumed to be a validated session, as it was checked by enter()
        Returns:
        1 of the 2:
        • unauthorized(login.render())
        • ok(admin/student/ivigilatorView.render())

      • enter

        public static Result enter()
        Tries to login in a user and register the session when successful. Logging is done by performing variaous checks and validations, which includes:
        • authentication, which is done by querying the login methods in data models
          • Student.login(String,String)
          • Invigilator.login(String,String)
          • Admin#login(String,String)
        • login form validity
        • login form completeness
        • domain existence
        Returns:
        JsonNode wrapped in a ok-object. It has one filed - error, which has 2 possibilities, either a 0, or a string.
        • If it is 0, it means loggin is successful
        • if it's a string, it means loggin is unsuccessful and the string itself is the error message

      • logout

        public static Result logout()
        remove session.
        Returns:
        login page wrapped in an ok HTTP reponse
